p: Some FVEOs and CGEOs samples showed MICs at the highest used concentration ( Table 1 and Table 2). No antimicrobial activity on staphylococci was recorded for any of the RSEOs, except for the R30 sample that showed a MIC value of 25 mg/mL ( Table 3). Only seven out 89 EOs displayed MIC values of 6.25 mg/mL against the two S. aureus strains ( Table 1, Table 2 and Table 3). As control, MIC was also evaluated for conventional a antibiotic, ofloxacin, belonging to the fluoroquinolone family.
